intro: Thesium alpinum subsp. pratense, commonly known as the alpine thesium, is a perennial herb native to alpine regions of Europe. It features erect, sparsely branched stems that are often covered in short, glandular hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Its leaves are linear to lanceolate, with a bluish-green hue and a hairy surface. It thrives in nutrient-poor, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
